Class JkResolutionParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.depmanagement.JkResolutionParameters
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class JkResolutionParameters
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    CInstances of this class are used to parameter the dependency resolution
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JkScopeMapping defaultMapping()
      Returns the default scope mapping to use for the JkDependencies to be resolved.
      static JkResolutionParameters defaultScopeMapping(JkScopeMapping scopeMapping)
      Creates resolution parameters with the specified default scope mapping and no dynamic version resolving refresh.
      static JkResolutionParameters of()
      Creates resolution parameters without default mapping and no dynamic version resolving refresh.
      boolean refreshed()
      Returns true if during the resolution phase, the dynamic version must be resolved as well or the cache can be reused.
      JkResolutionParameters refreshed(boolean refreshed)

      • of

        public static JkResolutionParameters of()
        Creates resolution parameters without default mapping and no dynamic version resolving refresh.
        See Also:

      • defaultScopeMapping

        public static JkResolutionParameters defaultScopeMapping(JkScopeMapping scopeMapping)
        Creates resolution parameters with the specified default scope mapping and no dynamic version resolving refresh.
        See Also:
        defaultMapping(), refreshed()

      • defaultMapping

        public JkScopeMapping defaultMapping()
        Returns the default scope mapping to use for the JkDependencies to be resolved. null means no default scope mapping.
        See Also:
        Ivy configuration doc

      • refreshed

        public boolean refreshed()
        Returns true if during the resolution phase, the dynamic version must be resolved as well or the cache can be reused.
